# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the Julia code that fulfills your task:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)::String
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        elseif isempty(current_line) 
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit"))
```

The `wrap_string` function splits the input string into words and checks if adding a new word to the current line would exceed the maximum text width. If it does, we push the current line onto the list of lines and start a new one. This process repeats until all words have been processed, and then we add the final line to our list of lines. The result is returned as a single string with newline characters between each line.
